benchmark_details.name: fMoW-mm (multimodal dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce fMoW-mm, a multimodal dataset incorporating satellite imagery, maps, metadata, and text annotations, aimed at enhancing vision-language datasets for remote sensing.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the generation of detailed and context-rich captions for remote sensing images using external data sources.

data.source: Combination of satellite images from fMoW-rgb, maps from OpenStreetMap, and associated metadata.
data.annotation: Generated captions using GPT-4o integrated with metadata and maps.

metrics: FDR (False Discovery Rate) to evaluate hallucinations
methodology.calculation: FDR calculated using precision over proper nouns based on reference lists of correct landmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Lower FDR indicates fewer hallucinations in the generated captions.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison with vision-language models like CLIP and RemoteCLIP demonstrated higher performance with the fMoW-mm dataset.
methodology.validation: Performance evaluated through ablation studies on map resolutions and types, and the effectiveness in few-shot object detection.
